snippet: Israeli security officials point to an erosion of Egyptian sovereignty and authority in the vast, sandy expanses of the Sinai desert, particularly in the year since the Egyptian revolution.
abstract: Israel rushes to complete 150-mile steel border fence to ward off infiltration from Sinai Peninsula, buffer area between Israel and Egypt; Israeli military officials say there are hundreds of terrorists in Sinai, and militant activity mostly emanates from the Palestinian enclave of Gaza and global jihadist cells originating in North Africa; Egypt discounts Israel's allegations of terrorism.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from the Negev Desert, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo. Mayy el Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Israeli security officials point to an erosion of Egyptian sovereignty and authority in the vast, sandy expanses of the Sinai desert, particularly in the year since the Egyptian revolution.

headline.seo: Israel Guards Against Terror From Laxly Patrolled Sinai
headline.main: Israel Guards Against Increased Terror Peril From a Laxly Patrolled Sinai
headline.print_headline: Israel Guards Against Increased Terror Peril From a Laxly Patrolled Sinai
